backend/main.mo: Motoko backend defining dialogue, activities, moments, letters, and per‑player game state with functions to start or continue a game.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence list mapping collision‑trigger features to involved frontend files and components with test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of many frontend files describing their roles in UI, 3D scene, controls, state, and minigames.
frontend/DEPLOYMENT_TROUBLESHOOTING.md: Guide for diagnosing and retrying failed Internet Computer deployments.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles and theme variables for light/dark modes with color tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point wiring the root div and bootstrapping the React app.
frontend/OPS_CANISTER_AVAILABILITY.md: Operational notes on keeping the canister running and handling server‑offline issues.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app controller handling startup, backend availability, screen routing, game launch logic, and diagnostics tracking.
frontend/src/config/adminGate.ts: Local‑only admin gate config defining a username and derived storage key for admin unlock state.
Defines activity data with trust effects and optional unlocks for moments.
frontend/src/game/audio/useAudio.ts: Manages global audio settings and playback using Zustand, including volume, mute state, and background music control.
frontend/src/game/characters/Puro.tsx: React Three Fiber component for Puro with idle animation, hover effects, and click-triggered dialogue.
frontend/src/game/controls/MobileControl: Touch control overlay providing joystick, look controls, and jump handling for mobile devices.
frontend/src/game/controls/usePlayerCont: Combines keyboard and joystick inputs into movement and look data while respecting pause and terminal states.
Zustand store holding raw control inputs like joystick, look delta, and jump requests.
frontend/src/game/customization/customiz: Static data describing customizable items and their possible placement locations.
Defines a branching dialogue tree with nodes, choices, trust effects, and optional trust requirements.
frontend/src/game/GameView.tsx: Main game view that initializes state, mounts the 3D scene, manages HUD and UI panels, and handles pause and audio setup.
frontend/src/game/letters/letterTemplate: Provides categorized response templates and generates a reply based on keywords in a letter.
frontend/src/game/minigames/BookSortingM: Implements a drag-and-drop book‑sorting game that adjusts trust and detects completion.
frontend/src/game/minigames/DrawingMiniG: Displays a gallery of Puro's drawings where viewing each increases trust.
frontend/src/game/minigames/HideAndSeekM: Runs a timed hide‑and‑seek guessing game with trust rewards and penalties.
frontend/src/game/minigames/MiniGameLaun: Provides a menu to launch different mini‑games and manages their lifecycle.
frontend/src/game/moments/MomentPlayer.t: Shows a selected narrative moment with scene text and a close button.
frontend/src/game/moments/momentsData.ts: Defines moment data entries with titles, descriptions, scenes, and trust requirements.
frontend/src/game/scene/LibraryScene.tsx: Renders the 3D library scene with player movement, jump physics, camera control, and Puro proximity detection.
frontend/src/game/state/useGameStore.ts: Zustand store defining game and UI state plus actions for trust, activities, dialogue, letters, endings, and customization, persisted locally.
frontend/src/game/story/endings.ts: Defines ending data and a helper that returns the correct ending based on trust thresholds.
frontend/src/game/story/EndingScene.tsx: React component that displays the final ending based on trust level and allows starting a new game or returning to the title.
frontend/src/game/ui/ActivityMenu.tsx: Menu for performing activities that modify trust, mark completion, unlock moments, and close the panel.
UI for placing discovered customization items in the library and viewing already placed items.
frontend/src/game/ui/DialoguePanel.tsx: Dialogue system panel showing dialogue text, trust‑based choices, and navigation through dialogue nodes.
frontend/src/game/ui/LettersPanel.tsx: Panel for writing letters, sending them, and viewing auto‑generated responses in an inbox.
frontend/src/game/ui/MomentsMenu.tsx: Displays a list of unlockable moments and allows playing unlocked ones via MomentPlayer.
frontend/src/game/ui/PauseMenu.tsx: Pause menu providing resume, quick-access navigation, settings, terminal (if unlocked), and reset options.
frontend/src/game/ui/SettingsScreen.tsx: Settings UI for adjusting audio volume, toggling mute, and returning to the previous screen.
frontend/src/game/ui/TrustMeter.tsx: Shows current trust level with color-coded label and progress bar.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user's identity, invalidating dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendAvailabilit: Checks backend health using an actor and exposes status, errors, timestamps, and refetch control.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity context with login, logout, status tracking, and AuthClient initialization.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for synced backend gameplay actions like fetching game state, making choices, and updating progress.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind layers and a warm color palette with light and dark themes plus base typography.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/startup.ts: Handles one‑time startup tasks including storage checks and asset preloading.
frontend/src/state/useAdminGateStore.ts: Zustand store providing a simple local username gate to unlock admin mode.
Empty placeholder file for a future server access store.
frontend/src/ui/AdminAccessPanel.tsx: UI panel for entering a local admin username to unlock or lock admin mode.
frontend/src/ui/CreditsScreen.tsx: Displays the game's credits, features, and a back button over a themed background.
frontend/src/ui/DiagnosticTerminalOverla: Admin‑only in‑app terminal overlay supporting command execution and live output.
frontend/src/ui/GameLaunchErrorScreen.ts: Shows user‑friendly and detailed error info when game launch fails, with retry and back options.
frontend/src/ui/GameRuntimeErrorBoundary: React error boundary that catches game runtime errors and displays a UI with optional stack details and a back-to-title button.
frontend/src/ui/ServerStatusIndicator.ts: Shows a small status badge indicating backend health with colored text and icon.
frontend/src/ui/terminal/commands.ts: Implements a simple terminal command parser handling help, clear, diagnostics, and server status checks.
frontend/src/ui/terminal/useTerminalDiag: Formats diagnostic data into readable text lines for terminal display.
frontend/src/ui/terminal/useTerminalStor: Zustand store managing terminal visibility, input/output lines, and state updates.
frontend/src/ui/TitleScreen.tsx: Main title screen UI with game start options, admin tools, server status display, and offline notices.
frontend/src/utils/launchErrorNormalizat: Normalizes launch-related errors into categorized user-friendly summaries with preserved raw messages.
frontend/STARTUP.md: Documentation explaining the startup sequence, responsibilities of startup.ts, and how App.tsx invokes it.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending theme colors, fonts, animations, and enabling plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks versioned project state, architectural notes, and known issues for a 3D visual-novel hybrid game dependent on an Internet Computer backend. Highlights gameplay structure, admin-control constraints, backend availability requirements, and multiple unresolved technical conflicts/errors.
